oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Risikobewertungen zur Voraussage von Erkrankungen in ökologisch wirtschaftenden Betrieben in Niedersachsen
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Krömker, Volker
Haverkamp, Hilke
Volling, Otto
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dairy cattle
Animal husbandry
Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Within the scope of a follow up study simple risk assessments were carried out in 82 milk cows in 9 organic dairy farms in Lower Saxony. Risk assessments were used as a method to predict periparturient diseases. The risk assessments were based on published scientific data. By an animal-individual risk assessment a clear prediction of ketosis succeeded. Based on this knowledge an effective pro- and metaphylaxis can be applied to individual animals. Investigations of a bigger random sample are necessary to expand the risk evaluations on other diseases.
